intro: Coccoloba emarginata, commonly known as the margined coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into five to seven lobes. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Coccoloba emarginata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
